name: Lotka–Volterra predator–prey model
equations: dx/dt = α x - β x y; dy/dt = δ x y - γ y
description_simple: A two-dimensional deterministic model of interacting predator and prey populations that typically exhibits closed orbits in phase space.
description_complex: A classical nonlinear model for predator–prey dynamics, defined by coupled first-order differential equations with bilinear interaction terms. In the simplest parameter regime without additional damping or noise, trajectories lie on closed orbits around a neutrally stable equilibrium, yielding regular oscillations without deterministic chaos, strange attractors, or sensitive dependence on initial conditions.
